lead_paragraph: Howard Porter, a former Villanova star and a probation officer in Minnesota, was trying to trade money and crack cocaine for sex with a prostitute when he was beaten to death, according to murder charges filed against a St. Paul man. Porter, 58, died May 26, a week after he was found unconscious in a Minneapolis alley. Rashad Arthur Raleigh, 29, was arrested Sunday and charged yesterday with second-degree murder.
